issues.description: The `checkOrderReady` method is declared to return `void` in the problem specification (UML and text) but is implemented to return `boolean` in the reference solution. This mismatch in return type can confuse students about the intended signature and cause compilation or test failures.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the reference solution with the specification by changing the method signature to `public void checkOrderReady()` (removing the boolean return) or update the problem description to expect a `boolean` return if that return value is needed.
